issue.title: Tracking domains
issue.body:
Hello!
There is a site called iplogger.com that allows you to create and insert a tracking pixel into any email (or even a website).

Here is a link to this service:
https://iplogger.org/tracking-pixel/

In the end, the links will look something like this:

```
iplogger[.]com/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]org/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]co/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]info/1V8mH4.jpg
mapper[.]info/1V8mH4.jpg
2no[.]co/1V8mH4.jpg
yip[.]su/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]com/1V8mH4.jpg
ipgraber[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
ipgrabber[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
iplis[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
02ip[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
ezstat[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
wl[.]gl/1V8mH4.jpg
ed[.]tk/1V8mH4.jpg
bc[.]ax/1V8mH4.jpg
```

**So I suggest you the following rules:**
```
||iplogger.com^$third-party
||iplogger.org^$third-party
||iplogger.ru^$third-party
||iplogger.co^$third-party
||iplogger.info^$third-party
||mapper.info^$third-party
||2no.co^$third-party
||yip.su^$third-party
||iplogger.com^$third-party
||ipgraber.ru^$third-party
||ipgrabber.ru^$third-party
||iplis.ru^$third-party
||02ip.ru^$third-party
||ezstat.ru^$third-party
||wl.gl^$third-party
||ed.tk^$third-party
||bc.ax^$third-party
```

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

_No response_

Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did

comment.body:
> Limit could be extended, but Op states he currently only has two lists active. iOS sadly treats iframe's requests as the main page, so every rule which targets iframe must be applied to main page too (for iOS)

I have deleted the three old user rules you wanted me to add, and I have now added the five new ones you just commented. I did them one by one, waited for the gray bar at the bottom of the app (rules are being converted, etc.) to disappear. I then went to the home menu of the app, and clicked the updating button. I did the same process for the other four. Some had updates, some didn't. For each one, the video was still broken.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
